body:
I concur, I had written this code in a temporary state of mind waiting for
people comments but had almost no comment & could never refactor it
deeper...

On Sun, Dec 7, 2014 at 12:36 PM, timgoodchild notifications@github.com
wrote:

> When merging JSON arrays, the resulting array does not contain any of the
> source array in the JsObject on which deepMerge was invoked. The resulting
> array contains only the entries that live within the object passed in to
> deepMerge.
> 
> The source code is of deepMerge is complicated and is annotated with :-
> "TODO : improve because coding is nasty there"
> 
> However it is clear that the code is written to detect JsObject and make a
> recursive call but there is no special handling of JsArrays and I suspect
> this is where the problem lies.
> 
> I have created a failing test using ScalaTest and this is available at the
> following Gist
> 
> https://gist.github.com/timgoodchild/c50a3f7234e4183873a0
> 
> Play 2.3.6
> Java 1.7
> Mac OSX Mavericks
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/3717.

issue.title: Fixes issue where deep merge does not handle JsArray.  Re-implemented de...

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
...epMerge to address comment that coding is complex and needs to be improved. Fix #3717 

@mandubian

Please recall discussion on 3717 where you were looking for input as to how to improve the deep merge.
I have written something which I believe is easy to understand and follows the same principle i.e. that attributes from the object being passed in win in the case of a conflict.  The function now supports handling of JsArray in that the arrays are concatenated.

issue.title: [2.4.0] behaviour of the Json.deepMerge method is different than in playframework 2.3.x

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Hi, 

playframework 2.4.0 has different behaviour of Json.deepMerge method. This code:

```
val js1 = Json.parse( """{"property1":"x", "data":["a"]}""")
val js2 = Json.parse( """{"property1":"x", "data":["a"]}""")
println(js1.as[JsObject].deepMerge(js2.as[JsObject]))
```

prints in play 2.4.0: 

```
{"property1":"x","data":["a", "a"]} 
```

However in play 2.3.x it prints: 

```
{"property1":"x","data":["a"]}
```

Because that some JSON transformation has different result. See my another issue:

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/4622
